\index{dockable\_resized() (gui.core.Grid method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.dockable_resized}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable\_resized}}}{\emph{dockable}}{}
Signal to this grid that the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable}}’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin.col\_span}} and/or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin.row\_span}} has been changed, and thus it must be redrawn and its position must be recalculated.
If it must be moved, it will be moved as little as possible. If no where on the grid satisfies its new size, the
grid is expanded horizontally as needed to accommodate the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}}) \textendash{} The dockable that has been resized.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{geometry (gui.core.Grid attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.geometry}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{geometry}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = None}}}
The grid’s current \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridGeometry}}.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{grid\_visual (gui.core.Grid attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.grid_visual}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{grid\_visual}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = None}}}
The current \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{VisualSpec}} for the grid drawn while a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} is dragged.

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{move\_dockable() (gui.core.Grid method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.move_dockable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{move\_dockable}}}{\emph{dockable}, \emph{cell}}{}
Move the given \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} to the given \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Cell}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cell}}. If there is a grid conflict, this
will fail and no changes will be made.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}}) \textendash{} The dockable to move.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cell}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{api:gui.core.Cell}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Cell}}}}}) \textendash{} The cell to move the dockable to.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Whether or not the move was successful.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
bool

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{orig\_geometry (gui.core.Grid attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.orig_geometry}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{orig\_geometry}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = None}}}
Stores the geometry (as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridGeometry}}) before any changes from window resizing are made.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_dockable() (gui.core.Grid method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.register_dockable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_dockable}}}{\emph{dockable}}{}
Register a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} to be managed by this grid. Its tkinter parent must already be this grid.

Registered dockables should never be manually (i.e. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable.configure(...)}}) positioned, have their width
and height manually changed, etcetera. Instead use the appropriate methods on \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} objects.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}}) \textendash{} The dockable to be managed by this grid.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{remove\_dockable() (gui.core.Grid method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.remove_dockable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{remove\_dockable}}}{\emph{dockable}}{}
Remove the given \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} from the grid. This method is functionally the opposite of
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.\_place\_dockable}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dockable}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin}}) \textendash{} The dockable to remove.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{resize\_protocol (gui.core.Grid attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.resize_protocol}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{resize\_protocol}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ = None}}}
An integer representing the protocol to employ when the parent window is resized such that the grid’s canvas is
granted more space than required by its current scrollregion.
\begin{description}
\item[{May be one of the following:}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.RESIZE\_PROTO\_NONE}}: Do nothing when the window is resized.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.RESIZE\_PROTO\_EXPAND\_CELLS}}: Expand each cell equally to fit any new space when the window is            resized.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.RESIZE\_PROTO\_ADD\_PADDING}}: Add padding equally in between each column or row when the window            is resized.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{set\_geometry() (gui.core.Grid method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Grid.set_geometry}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_geometry}}}{\emph{width=None}, \emph{height=None}, \emph{cell\_width=None}, \emph{cell\_height=None}, \emph{column\_padding=None}, \emph{row\_padding=None}}{}
Request the grid’s geometry (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.geometry}}) to be changed.

Note that \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cell\_width}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cell\_height}} have minimums, and, in the event that a requested change to them
violates these minimums, they will be clamped greater than the minimums. The minimums are
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.MIN\_CELL\_WIDTH}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Grid.MIN\_CELL\_HEIGHT}}.

Also, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{width}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{height}} cannot be changed so as to “clip off” any \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DockableMixin{}`{}`s on the grid.
Therefore, once again, the {}`{}`width}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{height}} will be clamped to be greater than the minimum width and
height of the grid state (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridState.min\_width}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridState.min\_height}}).

To check if any of the requested new dimensions have been denied, consult the returned \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridGeometry}} object,
which contains the geometries actually deployed.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new width of the grid, or None for no change.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new height of the grid, or None for no change.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cell\_width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new cell width of the grid, or None for no change.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cell\_height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new cell height of the grid, or None for no change.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{column\_padding}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new column padding of the grid, or None for no change.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{row\_padding}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The new row padding of the grid, or None for no change.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
The new \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{GridGeometry}} object.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api:gui.core.GridGeometry}]{\sphinxcrossref{GridGeometry}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{Point (class in gui.core)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api:gui.core.Point}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gui.core.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Point}}}{\emph{x}, \emph{y}}{}~\index{x (gui.core.Point attribute)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
